action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.
guess: apple

attempts = 1
target_word = cynic
guess = apple
guess_feedback = a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will try a completely different set of letters, avoiding any overlap with the previous guess.
guess: round

attempts = 2
target_word = cynic
guess = round
guess_feedback = r<red> o<red> u<red> n<yellow> d<red>

guess_feedback: r<red> o<red> u<red> n<yellow> d<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is correct but in the wrong position, so I will include "n" in a different spot while avoiding the other letters from the previous guesses.
guess: snail

attempts = 3
target_word = cynic
guess = snail
guess_feedback = s<red> n<yellow> a<red> i<green> l<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> n<yellow> a<red> i<green> l<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "i" is correct and in the right position, while "n" is correct but still in the wrong position. I will keep "i" in the third position and move "n" to a different spot, avoiding the other letters.
guess: minty

attempts = 4
target_word = cynic
guess = minty
guess_feedback = m<red> i<yellow> n<green> t<red> y<yellow>

guess_feedback: m<red> i<yellow> n<green> t<red> y<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is correct and in the right position, while "i" and "y" are correct but in the wrong positions. I will keep "n" in the second position, move "i" and "y" to different spots, and avoid the other letters.
guess:inyin
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: qwen-max) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: My previous guess was invalid, so I will try another word that fits the feedback: "n" is correct and in the right position, "i" and "y" are correct but misplaced. I will rearrange them into a valid word.
guess: shiny

attempts = 5
target_word = cynic
guess = shiny
guess_feedback = s<red> h<red> i<yellow> n<yellow> y<yellow>

guess_feedback: s<red> h<red> i<yellow> n<yellow> y<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "i," "n," and "y" are correct but misplaced. I will rearrange them into a valid word while ensuring no letters are repeated incorrectly.
guess:inyin
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: qwen-max) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: My previous guess was invalid, so I will try another valid arrangement of the letters "i," "n," and "y" based on the feedback.
guess: tinny

attempts = 6
target_word = cynic
guess = tinny
guess_feedback = t<red> i<yellow> n<green> n<red> y<yellow>
game_result = LOSS

guess_explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.
All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will try a completely different set of letters, avoiding any overlap with the previous guess.
The letter "n" is correct but in the wrong position, so I will include "n" in a different spot while avoiding the other letters from the previous guesses.

The letter "i" is correct and in the right position, while "n" is correct but still in the wrong position. I will keep "i" in the third position and move "n" to a different spot, avoiding the other letters.

My previous guess was invalid, so I will try another word that fits the feedback: "n" is correct and in the right position, "i" and "y" are correct but misplaced. I will rearrange them into a valid word.
My previous guess was invalid, so I will try another valid arrangement of the letters "i," "n," and "y" based on the feedback.
